articles.title: New research shows South Africa's levy on sugar-sweetened drinks is having an impact - The Conversation Africa
articles.description: The results are in: South Africa’s ground-breaking health promotion levy, introduced in 2018, is working.
articles.content:
Three years ago South Africa introduced Africas first major tax on sugar-sweetened beverages based on grams of sugar. The tax now stands at about 11% of the price per litre. 
We assessed the impact … [+5434 chars]

articles.title: Nova Scotia enlists historically Black churches to help get COVID-19 vaccine to African Nova Scotians - The Globe and Mail
articles.description: Province combatting hesitancy among older African Nova Scotians by using pastors and community leaders to encourage people to get their shot
articles.content: Eugene Anderson receives the Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine from Carolyne Aremo, RN, at the first vaccine clinic in an African Nova Scotian community, in Upper Hammonds Plains, N.S., on April 8, 20… [+5377 chars]

articles.title: SADC vows 'proportionate' response to Mozambique's jihadists - eNCA
articles.description: Six presidents from the Southern African Development Community (SADC) held emergency talks in the Mozambican capital Maputo.
articles.content: MAPUTO - Southern Africa's regional bloc on Thursday vowed a "proportionate" response to jihadists who last month raided a key town in northern Mozambique in a sharp escalation of a three-year-old in… [+2206 chars]

articles.title: Covid-19: African Union drops AstraZeneca from its vaccine plan - News24
articles.description:
The African Union's disease control body said on Thursday it has dropped plans to secure
AstraZeneca vaccines for its members.
articles.content:
• The African Union has dropped the AstraZeneca vaccine from its procurement plans.
